did.unittitle: Union League of Philadelphia Board of Publications records

bioghist.p: The Union League of Philadelphia was founded in 1862 as a patriotic society to support the policies of President Abraham Lincoln. It evolved to its current identity as a non-sectarian and non-partisan private club. The Board of Publications was one of the original standing committees responsible for one of the League's primary functions: to disseminate patriotic literature in support of the Union. The Board first met February 26, 1863; original Board resigned December 6, 1864; new Board formed February 15, 1865; last met December 30, 1868; abolished in 1893 and responsibility for publication was assigned to the Library Committee. Publications eventually concerned only membership matters, and eventually came under the stewardship of the Member Relations Committee.

scopecontent.p: The records include: minutebook, 1863-1876; bylaws, 1863-1868; publication distribution, February-June, 1863; and pamphlets produced by the Union League, 1863-1945.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
